Reviews.Title: “Best boutique stay in town.”
Reviews.Author: T G
Reviews.Content: I adore this small hotel. What is not to like about it? O.K., the re-do of the tables in the breakfast area is not my favourite, compared to what it was... But, the smartly designed rooms are still as comfortable as ever, the concierge service is still top notch and helpful as ever, and the location is brilliant in quieter old Montreal. Merci, merci, merci!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela C
Reviews.Content: This last February 2012, I stayed in the Gault for one night and was very pleased overall. Its minimalistic decor is elegant yet cozy, and done with very good taste. The service was personalized and attentive. I also held a business meeting in their conference room and their facilities were perfect. I will definitely stay here again. I sincerely recommend it for both business and pleasure...

Reviews.Title: “great getaway”
Reviews.Author: PCGJsoif
Reviews.Content: Great staff always ready to help , great location in Old Montreal and the rooms are stunning! modern yet cozy, very elegant and quiet breakfast room in the lobby, i could spend every morning here, cant wait to get back at my favorite Montreal boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Great rooms. Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Facadieb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first time in March. The property was recommended by a friend and I was not disappointed. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room I had was spacious and bright. The bed was very comfortable. Overall I was very impressed and I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Ole_Brom
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Montreal 2-5 times per year since 1989, and have stayed at many of the hotels downtown. Some years ago I discovered the Gault. Since then I have not considered any other options. The rooms are great and the service is excellent. I spend 150+ night per year in various hotel rooms and know a good one when I get there. The rooms at the Gault has everything I need: An excellent bed, a good workspace and a good shower. The decor and design is very nice and I really feel at home there. The staff are very (but not overly) friendly and help you out with anything you need without hestiaton. There are few hotels where I think "I look forward to come back" but the Gault is really one of them!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly staff, lovely rooms, amazing showers :)”
Reviews.Author: Ghookwaymorgan
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing time at Gault for my friend's wedding. Thoroughly reccomend the place to anyone going to Montreal. The rooms are stunning...

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cozdas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a two-day business trip. I liked the modern spacious style of the hotel. The hotel is very clean and quiet and It's location is very convenient. The staff was top notch, they were super friendly, especially the concierge Andre and the barmaid (whose name I can't remember unfortunately) was incredibly warm and friendly; very impressed. Our schedule was tight and could not spend time in this warm atmosphere but I'd definitely want to stay here again in my next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Janet S
Reviews.Content: Andre and the staff at Hotel Gault were terrific. They provided great recommendations for what to do and see in Montreal and made the trip that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Most Stylist place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: appleberri
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and i must say i was truly impressed with the peoperty overall. Everything from the style to the service was top notch! Definately the place to stay in Old Montreal. It is so close to shopping, restaurants and pubs.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ob0t
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Gault for 2 nights in April 2011. We booked a loft room, which was decorated in a very clean, modern style. This is definitely a place for people who would appreciate something a bit different - concrete floors (but heated and very warm), and very clean lines and high ceilings - a great, uncluttered environment in which to relax. The bar and lounge were very comfortable, and the staff very helpful. Unlike other super chic and fashionable hotels, these guys don't seem to be trying overly hard to maintain an 'image', and we still received great service despite our scruffy, jet-lagged appearance.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: HeidiNYC
Reviews.Content: We often travel to Montreal and the Hotel Gault is by far our favorite place to stay in the city. In fact, it feels like home away from home, mainly because the staff just gets it right from the moment you walk in until the moment you leave. On top of that, the hotel atmosphere and the rooms are great; cozy, clean, quiet, not overstuffed, everything you need is there. There are many nice hotels out there but it's the little things that make a place literarily "out-standing": A coffee or tea is offered when you arrive (nice after a long or maybe stressful trip), the friendly, helpful staff greets you as soon as you come into the lobby (ever being ignored by front desk staff when you wanted to check in?), nobody rushes you through breakfast, even after 3 hours reading the paper on a Sunday morning, and you generally just feel well taken care of. (Oh yes, and you can actually open the windows in your room, not just turn a noise air conditioner on or off - Thanks for that.) I wish more reasonably priced hotels would be like the Gault.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, cool bar and tasty breakfasts.”
Reviews.Author: Pepysp
Reviews.Content: The entrance and the welcome is good. There was a problem setting up my iPad which was dealt with strait away by the helpful staff. The room was clean, modern and airy. Plenty of space and a really comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: dhdruyff
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel for it's stunning decor, which I'll call "soft modern", meaning clean+ hip+ warm without looking like it's trying too hard (or like an office - I'm looking at you, business hotels.) Even more, we loved the people - the staff is wonderful, welcoming and made us feel valued even though we were just there for one night. I'm eager to return to this great boutique hotel. We had a terrific experience at Hotel Gault!

Reviews.Title: “The Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: mvrandshker
Reviews.Content: *Please note, this review is only of the bar/concierge/bartender service. The concierge is top-notch. We were wandering around Montreal looking for a warm bar with some atmosphere and the concierge from Hotel Gault spotted us. He walked us into his hotel and inquired about the rest of our night. With dinner reservations later in the night, he even printed us a map! What a considerate individual! If you stay here this is the kind of attention you can expect to receive. The female bartender also went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable. Many thanks to Hotel Gault

Reviews.Title: “Fab Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Mb G
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! The location is very convenient in old montreal. The decor is very hip and chic. The staff is very helpful and warm. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel in old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: EastsideGalSeattle
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Gault. Everything, from the staff to the clean and smartly decorated room with a great bed, was everything we could have hoped for. Before we booked, when I was reading other reviews, I was concerned by the references to starkness. Instead of stark, I would say they are very smartly outfitted and the space optimization gives you a lot of room to spread out in. Staying at Hotel Gault is the first time I have ever raved about the organization of a sink, shower and dressing area. They have a small but efficient gym, including a treadmill, elliptical, weight rack, and exercise ball. We also used the lounge area for cocktails and the library for afternoon coffees. Everything was very clean, in great condition and comfortable. The staff is indeed as marvelous as all the other reviewers claim. We will definitely be returning to Hotel Gault!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, close to everything...”
Reviews.Author: wvillegasv
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel, close to the Old Montreal and Downtown, is really superb. We arrived at 1 am to find a very nice front desk clerk, who took us to our room quickly, which was really appreciated because of the late hour. The room was large, nicely decorated, and well appointed. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was huge, with a shower, and a tub. Everybody we encountered was really nice, and eager to please. The hotel is walking distance to everything there is to see in Montreal, the Old city and the modern downtown area, however on a quiet street. The metro station is just a few blocks away, but finding a taxi was no problem at all. Yes, there is a Five Guys just one block away, but why would you eat there, having an excellent restaurant on site, and so many good restaurants just a few blocks away. We did not use the spa services, however I'm sure they are as great as everything else in the hotel. Thank you all at Hotel Gault, I can't remember all of your names, however you made our first (and not last) visit to Montreal unforgettable... we will be back... in the Summer =)

Reviews.Title: “First class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bad_2_the_bone
Reviews.Content: Chic hotel in heart of Montreal. Beautiful decor and an outstanding staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, central and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JeremyCondor
Reviews.Content: I took a loft room, which, according to the floor plan was small compared to the other rooms on the top floor. However the room was very well designed, spacious and cleverly laid out - I very much appreciated the counter and stools in the seating area and the spacious balcony. There had obviously been a second set of curtains that had been removed from the room - leaving the curtain rails and a set of naked hooks - a rather tacky omission in what was otherwise an impeccable decor. The problem with minimalism in hotel design is that the slightest visual glitch is evident... Overall the hotel is very thoughtfully designed - and I enjoyed the artful simplicity, style and comfort of the whole place. STaff members were exceptionally warm, knowledgable and competent. The only downer is arrival. I was very unhappy about having to schlepp my luggage up the steep front steps, after a long journey - and without any help. This rather marrs the arrival and check in, which was otherwise excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Modern Luxury”
Reviews.Author: M39
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at Hotel Gault. Service was amazing from the minute we arrived. I did arrive late on Friday night, check-in was 10+ professional, all the staff at the hotel were incredibly friendly and helpful. We were lucky enough to receive a room upgrade to a Jr. Suite - AMAZING. Welcomed with a personal note and sweet treat of two cookies and a bottle of sparkling cider which was again such a lovely surprise. Loved the open modern concept with European feel including the exposed brick wall. Bed was extremely comfortable, including pillows, everything was just lovely. Bathroom was huge with separate shower and great soaker tub which I certainly took advantage of after a long day of walking the entire city, over 5 hours of shopping, site seeing and eating...eating! Food was amazing everywhere. Warm fresh French pastries and coffee, who could want for more!! Concierge recommended a breakfast spot which did not disappoint - Cartet just a few minutes walking from the hotel, wonderful, might be considered a bit pricey for some, about $40 for two, but well worth it, service and food were fantastic, great atmosphere and also has a bit of a market at the front, so you can take some delicious snacks with you on the way out! Next time I am in Montreal I will definitely return to the Gault. Location was excellent, only a short walk to Notre Dame Basilique, shopping on St. Catharines Street and loads of restaurants. If I had to say one thing that could make this hotel any better it would just be that the lobby is not very "loungey", it's lovely but the bar area is connected to the reception so it's a bit odd. Not something that should stop anyone from coming here though especially since there are so many options for food and drink nearby. Hotel Gault - definitely 10 out of 10. Merci Beaucoup!!!

Reviews.Title: “Warmth and style”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Stowe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent Thanksgiving here with my brother and sister-in-law. It's a small, stylish, centrally located hotel, with a friendly, helpful staff. The pleasant lobby/lounge is a good place for drinks and breakfast. Easy walk to many Montreal attractions. Our fellow guests included business people, families, and couples, all of whom seemed happy to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iwilladviseyou
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here on a business trip because I couldn't get into the hotel where my conference was at, and it was a very pleasant surprise. It's an excellent location on the edge of the old city, and the staff was exceptionally nice - very friendly and very helpful. In terms of style, the hotel decor is very modern. I had a loft room and it had concrete floors, wood furniture and a seriously comfortable bed. I also came back to find complimentary cookies in my room the first night, which were excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling alone, as a couple or with friends for leisure trip. The only negative about the stay was that there wasn't really a work station, and the wireless Internet connection seemed to be spotty. Not an issue for the general business traveler, I think, but for someone who needs to set up an office in their room and do a lot of work it may be a problem depending on what room you are in.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: rrzzrr
Reviews.Content: 4 days at Hotel Gault for business that started to feel like a vacation. The hotel is very nice, the food very good, but the staff is where this hotel shines. Everyone is friendly, accommodating and high energy. Rooms were spacious with good amenities. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: JRW1950
Reviews.Content: Andre, the concierge, and Jonathan are dedicated to superb guest service. The fitness facility, breakfast service, and room layouts are excellent. Quiet, comfortable, great value. Highly recommended. Jim Warner - Boulder, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place but poor choice for business.”
Reviews.Author: billrosenblatt
Reviews.Content: Minimalist-chic loft rooms in beautiful old building in Old Montreal near the Convention Center. Gracious, friendly service and luxury-class furnishings in the rooms. However, I would not recommend it for business travel. No desks, no coffee makers, no irons/ironing boards, sparse lighting, flaky Wi-fi (at least when I was there), very small gym with only one treadmill and one elliptical trainer. I would not mind staying at the Gault if I came to Montreal on vacation, but if I come back on business I will go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “If only every hotels were like the Gault !”
Reviews.Author: Deborah F
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gault is definitely the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Located in the old Montreal, this historical building has been renovated to a modern, stylish yet very warm hotel. My loft-style bedroom was very big. The furniture is stylish, a lot of storage space (which hotel bedrooms usually lack of), an Ipod/Ipad dock, flat TV screen with blu-ray DVD player etc... The bed linens are of the best quality and I have to say that I haven't slept that well in years. Not only the mattress was the most comfortable I have ever experienced but the room was very quiet. I didn't hear any noise either from the street nor from other clients although the hotel was full (in most hotels you hear door slamming, next-door conversations etc...). The bathroom was huge with heated floor and a great bathtub. I usually only use the shower in hotels but for the first time in my life I actually used the hotel bathtub. In most hotel they're either too small, don't look clean etc... But there, I was looking forward every night for that relaxing moment especially as you can dim the light in the bathroom: there is no better way to unwind from a day of sight-seeing! The shower (separated from the tub) was also very nice with good water pressure. The pictures I took were on the night I arrived. I was so thrilled by my bedroom that I couldn't wait the next day (and the daylight) to take some pictures. Every night I came back to the room, I was greeted by some classical music and home-made biscuits/chocolate/meringue etc... depending on the chef's mood. The lobby is modern, with sofas, dining tables, a bar, a fireplace and even a big reading area where you can relax. The breakfast selection was very good and I also had a few lunches there (I recommend the home-made soups of the day). The staff is just like the hotel: very warm and welcoming ! Trying to please you as well as they can, offering suggestions on what to see, where to eat and always a step ahead of your requests. You are not a client but a guest which really makes the difference. I would really like to thank everyone for being so nice and helpful during my stay. If only every hotels were like the Gault !

Reviews.Title: “Great location,lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Jessimiah
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gault is very well situated in Old Montreal. Although this is a renovated historical building, the hotel is very modern and tasteful with very comfortable quiet rooms. The bathroom and bathtub in the room are huge. Upon arrival guests are welcomed with a beverage. The front desk staff are very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. We were very rested after a terrible first night at the Opus.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't come any better!!!”
Reviews.Author: JosNewZealand
Reviews.Content: The service from the staff at this hotel is - OUTSTANDING! I repeat OUTSTANDING!. There are too many things that the staff were willing to do to mention. I remember though when we arrived made us a cup of tea before we went up to our room - went out of their way to help with numerous enquiries we had - when the taxi came on the day of departure came rushing out and said we can't let you go without us saying goodbye to you properly and proceeded to give a hug/shaking hands. The hotel is a boutique size hotel in Old Montreal. The outside of the building is old but inside new. The hotel is handy to everything. The hotel is quiet. The hotel is out of this world and worth a visit to Montreal just to take in the experience of this hotel. We have stayed in a lot of hotels around the world and never had an experience like Hotel Gault Montreal. Congratulations to you all, you are one of a kind. Jos/Keith..

Reviews.Title: “this is it”
Reviews.Author: jmmorgadinho
Reviews.Content: I found out about the Gault via Wallpaper magazine Montreal guide. As usual, they were right. The hotel is perfectly located 2 minutes walk from St. Paul street, in the old city area. The hotel is a design/boutique style but not over the top, meaning you feel at home there. The lobby is cozy, with the fireplace, newspapers and sofa seating areas, the room I stayed in (520) is absolutely wonderful, with a private terrace, 2 windows/terrace door that go all the way to the ceiling, wood, Artemide lamps, heated floor in the toilet. The best you can have in an hotel, for my taste. I was undecided between the Gault and the W hotel, really glad I chose the Gault, the W is in Square Victoria (the Gault is at a nice 2 small street's corner) which is now full of tents with the "occupy"/"indignee" people of Montreal. The Gault, to be repeated (they even bring you 100CAD change to your car, looking for me on the street to satisfy my request...enough said!)

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: DrHSaid
Reviews.Content: Best service in Montreal, great attention to details. They really care about their customers and you will not be treated as a number but as a person. Very comfortable beds and the hotel style is very elegant with a touch of modernism. Olive et Gourmando just a minute away to enjoy one of the best breakfast in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: upperwestsidemands
Reviews.Content: My wife, baby, and I stayed at the Hotel Gault this past weekend. We travel frequently and try to book at well-recommended hotels, but despite the positive reviews the Hotel Gault gets here, it is still under-appreciated. From the moment we arrived, Alex/Alejandro attended to us perfectly, offering to heat our baby's milk, suggesting a wine to unwind with, and touring our post-modern room with us. The room was well-appointed and despite having bare walls and a concrete floor, did not feel barren. Au contraire, it felt warm and inviting and we debated pushing off the next step of our trip to stay longer. Top marks. This is up there with other memorable stays at similar properties, like the Hotel & Villa Auersperg in Salzberg.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and well appointed loft rooms make for dreamy stay in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: Tanquerochicago
Reviews.Content: I will keep this review short as there isn't much to say about Hotel Gault other than the staff is superb...every single employee I spoke to was open, accommodating, and interested in making our stay enjoyable. Our loft style room on the third floor had views of Old Montreal and was as romantic as scenes from a Parisian movie. Every detail in the room and the hotel has clearly been thought through. I loved being close to public transit, Bixi bikes (which I highly recomment), and cabs arrive within minutes. The hotel is close to several great dining options, right by the water, right by all these chic little boutiques...oh Montreal. Such a great city. Everything was excellent. I couldn't recommend a place more so than Hotel Gault. Just perfection!!! And Melissa was so attentive and accommodating. Thanks for making our first trip to Montreal so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: fattyflubber
Reviews.Content: Just finished a long weekend at the Hotel Gault. Most all of the reviews read were fairly accurate. The hotel is minimal on amenities, but provides outstanding service. The only criticism i would have is that I think the rooms would be better suited with carpet rather then the bare concrete. While I think I get the look they wanted, I didn't care for the concrete floors. The hallways were carpeted and I would have kept that throughout the rooms as well. As far as the service, I couldn't give them more praise. Everyone, and I mean everyone, on the staff were sincerely interested in being as helpful as they could be. The staff made our Montreal stay extremely pleasant with their intimate knowledge and advice on Montreal. I will give extra praise on their exceptional service to Alejandro, Andre, Andra and Elodie. Montreal is a great city to visit. The Hotel Gault is an initmate boutique hotel located in Vieux Montreal, clean, comfortable and with an amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Find”
Reviews.Author: parrot101
Reviews.Content: wow. great hotel, great location for business and fooling around. Large rooms, with huge windows. Well appointed and on a quiet street. A real find with only 30 rooms. Hopefully you won't have taken the last room when I come to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, friendly and very focused”
Reviews.Author: cunno
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 very comfortable nights at Hotel Gault and found the staff very friendly, helpful and professional. The location is excellent, the food sensational, the beds perfect and the decor very modern but functional. There are many fabulous restaurants and cafes within a few minutes walk and the Old Town ambience has a very European feel. An excellent all round Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location; attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Jessie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a special treat and it was. It's very easy to find from the highway; the room was ready with a sweet bite and classical music; the staff inquired after us every time we left or arrived; it was extremely clean; I loved the robes. We walked from the hotel up to St. Denis and through Old Montreal in only about 5 m / 8 km. Some of Montreal's best dinner spots are within a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleasant relaxing, comfortable and sophisticated boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurence_B_Jacobs
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Gault and from the moment we got there every single member of staff was pleasant and helpful. The location is perfect for a leisure break, very convenient but quiet. The room was spacious, light and airy, the bed was huge and comfortable. Only thing that would be helpful would an in room tea/ coffee making facility, especially for us folks from Europe. I travel the world over and am very pernickety and I was was very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Staff and Property”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth R
Reviews.Content: I have been a repeat guest this year as a result of a relocation to Montreal. The staff have made me feel like I am at home every day versus being in a hotel. Beyond the wonderful and attentive staff, the hotel is so comfortable with the most quiet rooms. Perfect location in Old Montreal for the tourist, but for the business person, still very easy to get into and out of for your meetings. Finally, the fact that Five Guys is one block away, just makes the Gault something to try over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: dvdkng
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in the old town of Montreal, the location of this hotel is ideal. It is close to all the charm but far enough from the hustle of rue St Paul. Our room was very spacious and comfortable (the bedding is reason to sleep in just a little bit longer). Above all, however, is the friendly and helpful staff. Whether sitting at the bar and chatting, or inquiring of restaurant recommendations, you will find them exceptional. They pointed us to restaurants that we would not have found on our own as typical tourist â€“ all excellent. They made all of our reservations including that for a rental car when our flight home was cancelled due to weather. The hotel was a memorable part of our Montreal visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Faraj
Reviews.Content: Staff were all, without exception, charming, helpful and friendly. Something I have not found in other hotels in this town. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Beds and bedding excellent quality. Wifi works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Great location. Superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: GayleR2
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely Labour Day weekend at Hotel Gault. The hotel is housed in a former YMCA in an historic building at the edge of Old Montreal. The hotel has been completely gutted and turned into a very contemporary boutique hotel. The location is superb as it is at the corner of two very quiet streets and away from the major foot traffic of the old city yet close enough to walk to restaurants, the subway and other attractions. If the hotel was busy, we would never have known as we rarely saw other guests. We stayed in a Junior Suite on the 2nd floor and it was a very large room with a stone/exposed brick wall, two sets of operational French doors, a king bed, a large free-standing acrylic soaker tub as well as a separate glassed shower with an adjustable Grohe rainhead and a separate WC as well as a very ample supply of Molten Brown products, an abundance of very good, thick, fluffy towels and a magnifying make-up mirror. The bed was extremely comfortable with very good linens, as others have noted. However, the floors are polished concrete and while they provide a funky, industrial vibe, they don't look clean and are not very comfortable as a living space surface. Terry slippers and robes are provided and with those floors you'll want to wear the slippers as the floors look and feel dirty. There are small area rugs (maybe 3 x 5) on each side of the bed, but these were quite filthy and badly in need of cleaning. The drapes are blackout drapes but they are falling off their tracks and you have to manoeuver them a certain way to get them to stay closed. There is very ample closet and drawer space, a safe, minibar, iPhone/iPod docking station and 42" flat screen TV. The hotel has a tiny lobby area dedicated to being a restaurant for breakfast as well as a bar area in the lobby but we never saw anyone at the bar. A few minor things were missing: - hotel book with hotel and local information - TV guide - a bedside clock - magazines related to Montreal But the most notable about The Gault is the staff. We have stayed at the best hotels all over the world and the staff were simply wonderful. They could not do enough. Upon arrival we were offered a beverage and chose an ice tea and an espresso. No charge. When we came back from our daily excursions, the staff eagerly wanted to hear about where we went and what we did. One day after four and a half hours of walking in extreme heat and humidity, icy bottles of water were proffered without asking. No charge. The concierge asked what restos we'd picked and provided tips and suggestions. I cannot say enough about the warmth, friendliness and service orientation of every staff member we met. And as a result, we were able to overlook some of the little things I mentioned above. We look forward to returning to Hotel Gault.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: leoed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Montreal from Boca Raton, Florida and weren't sure what our overall experience would be. From the minute we stepped into the Gault Hotel in Montreal,we were treated as if we were close friends. They took care of everything with that gracious Canadian hospitality and professionalism. The room was over 400 sq. ft and had a large bathroom. But, truly what made this hotel great was its staff. They couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. Do yourself a big favor. Skip the pretentious and overpriced hotels and come to the Hotel Gault. You will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “A welcome change from the chains”
Reviews.Author: Cdngirl_68
Reviews.Content: As all the reviews say, the staff here are terrific. The warm welcome, the concierge service to the room, the friendliness of everyone - all wonderful and very much appreciated. I came for one night only on business, with the goal of determining whether we would send our clients to the Gault, instead of the Intercontinental. I would describe the hotel as modern, not historic, all open concept bedroom/bathroom, very white/bare furnishings. The bed was fantastic. The room service was quick but the food was a bit mediocre. I didn't eat breakfast but the menu looked great. I haven't decided if this is the right hotel for our clients yet (no real 'historic' feeling to it) but I may try it again. What I do like is the free wireless and the 24-hour room service. I can't tolerate paying for wireless at hotels anymore; it's archaic. I totally give the Gault full marks for personalized, friendly service - something the Intercontinental can't come close to.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Gault!”
Reviews.Author: BijouxGirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Gault in Montreal for 4 nights and our experience there was fantastic. The room was modern and spacious and the use of an iPad during our stay and an iPhone docking station in the room were very nice bonuses. The employees at the Gault were very pleasant and most helpful in giving directions and making suggestions for restaurants in the area. We liked that the location of the Gault is near the center of Old Town Montreal but yet it was on a quiet street which made us feel like we were coming home each night. We would definitely stay at Hotel Gault again the next time we visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with great service, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Laurenbrookepenna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and it was beautiful. The hotel is modern and clean inside of a beautifully classic building in old Montreal. The service was amazing and we felt very welcome staying there. The only downside was that it was a bit pricey for us. They gave us a dessert plate in the first day that we thought was complimentary, but we were surprised when we were charged for it.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: jfried01Nyc
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review since my husband and I returned from our 3 night stay in July. I picked this hotel based on Trip Advisor, and you can add us to the chorus of highly satisfied guests! We are very fussy about hotels and few meet our admittedly sometimes unrealistic expectations. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. If you even opened a map while standing in the lobby, someone would ask if they could be of assistance. The people working at the hotel genuinely seem to enjoy their work, and it was a pleasure to return there at the end of a long day of sightseeing! The rooms are huge and immaculate. As many have said, they are very modern in furnishing, so don't be surprised by the loft-like feeling. We loved the room so much we wished our apartment looked like our room! Also, the food (breakfast and lunch) was delicious and not at all overpriced, unlike many hotels. Location can't be beat -- close to everything but still out of the main tourist strip. We loved Hotel Gault and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Should be #1 hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Nathan_M2TO
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at the Hotel Gault, checking in on a Thursday night and out on Sunday. It it is, by far, a hotel that I found to be charming, cozy, sophisticated and sexy, all at the same time. I was booked to stay at a large chain hotel the morning I departed for Montreal. But, after a quick call to the front desk of the Gault, I learned that I could stay at the Gault, with two hot breakfasts included in the nightly rate, for less than what I would have paid at the generic chain hotel. Though the rack rates at the hotel are not inexpensive, the pre-paid rates are considerably discounted. I got a very generously sized, well appointed room, with a king size bed and standalone shower for a very reasonable nightly rate. Because I booked the morning before I departed for Montreal, I was comfortable pre paying (the pre-paid bookings can not be cancelled). And for $10 more, my companion and I we able to each have a hot breakfast of eggs cooked to specification, toast, bacon, coffee, orange juice (freshly squeezed, no less) and a choice of fresh fruit, or cereal, or yogurt. It really was a lovely breakfast, served in the the dining area off the lobby, next to tall windows overlooking the streets of old Montreal. The service was excellent and the breakfast was a a great value for $10 for two people. The room itself was large, modern in style, very clean and well appointed. I had a Loft Deluxe. It had polished concrete floors, very high ceilings, gorgeous tall bright windows that opened to Juliet balconies, an area rug under the bed, and ipod/ipad dock, flat screen TV with DVD and cable television, lounge chairs and a coffee table, a comfy kind size bed behind which was a gauzy curtain separating the bathroom from the bedroom. Modern in style, the bathroom sink and closet area were open to the room (in the area behind the gauzy curtain), while a water closet and shower are located behind doors. And there was ample closet space. Towels and bathrobes are plush. All in all, it was a lovely room. I could have spent way more than just three days there. The lobby features modern, but comfortable furnishings and high ceilings. It has a very fresh and airy feel to it, in an understanted luxury kind of way. The lobby isn't much of a scene like you might find at other hotels, which is a good thing in my opinion. It was nice to come in from a day of sightseeing, or dinner, or shopping to the serene calm of the lobby, where you could unwind with a drink in the lobby. The staff would go so far as to inquire about your dinner/day/tour, etc, and gently invite you to enjoy a cocktail at the bar (or even have them sent to your room). The staff at the hotel are very professioinal, attentive, service-minded, charming, friendly and helpful. Restaurant and bar recommendations were excellent. I needed to store my luggage for the day after I checked out on Sunday, and they were more than helpful...even when I had to go back to retreive a few things I needed for my day in Montreal. On my return, the bags were promptly loaded to a taxi for my trip to the train station. The location of the hotel is fantastic, in Old Montreal. Cobblestone streets, elaborately ornate buildings, charming streets radiate every direction from the hotel. The hotel is a short walk to the Old Port, a short walk to the more bustling areas of Old Montreal, a short walk to shops and bars and restaurants (ask about Boris Brasserie, around the corner and it's c-h-a-r-m-i-n-g open-air courtyard dining area). The Metro is nearby. Cabs are plentiful down the street on McGill Street. Notre Dame Cathedral is a five minute walk away. And you're a 10-15 minute cab ride to the train station, bus station, shopping on Sherbrooke and St Catherine streets, the gay village, the Museum of Fine Art and retaurants on a street whose name escapes me at the moment, among other attractions. Additional note: the hotel is gay friendly. I highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to go back. In fact, I'm already thinking about my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Design and very well located”
Reviews.Author: Ashley0678
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms with design pieces of furniture like Arne Jacobsen look. Great staff, smiling, always available to help and giving very good tips! Perfect to stay a few days in Montreal, close to all places to see (walking distance).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, service and location very good.”
Reviews.Author: biker_michael
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night but were impressed. The staff were very professional and helpful, making suggestions and booking a restaurant for dinner for us. Well equipped rooms, iPod/iPhone docking station useful. We had breakfast, which was very good. Loan of an iPad for internet access a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Boutique Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JMCToronto
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a number of hotels in Montreal from the St. James, to the Ritz and Fairmount, I decided to try a smaller boutique hotel recommended on Trip Advisor and through friends. The Hotel Gault is now my favourite hotel in Montreal. It resides in the old city in a turn of the century building, with contemporary interior design. My room was lavish and extremely large, compared to similiarly priced hotels. Of note....the Gault is not cheap, but you really get "what you pay for". The service was fantastic and attentive without being sufficating. IPads for your stay, the gym, the breakfst options, the interior design and of course my room itself all added up to a definite re-visit in the near future. It is a small hotel so if your looking for the frenetic pace of the W or Fairmount, this is not it.....I would describe it as discrete chic, not garrish or loud. Thanks to the staff for making my weekend get-away in Montreal "Fantasiques"!

Reviews.Title: “Great people, mediocre value”
Reviews.Author: RickyRage
Reviews.Content: Just to putt he caveat prominently up front, I bought this room off of Jetsetter. The people in Hotel Gault could not have been nicer. The concierge, the reception staff, the valet, the other gentlemen who showed us our room and took our bags; all were exceptionally nice. They carried our bags, they made reservations, they did everything we can ask for. And they did it happily, and graciously. The hotel also had a lot of nice amenities. Amazingly hot water in the shower, very clean room, free stereo in the room, free wifi, and complimentary ipad to use in the hotel. When we checked in, they gave us glasses of water and soda, and free bottles of water in the room. The bed was also extremely comfortable. All very nice features! On the other hand, the place was pretty expensive: $240 a night after taxes. And possibly because we bought the room through Jetsetter, we got probably the least desirable room in the hotel. First floor above reception, right across from the elevator. It's an open layout so there was no separation for the bathroom (the toilet had a small door to get some privacy). The walls were fairly thin, the floors were bare concrete, and the walls were unadorned. There was only one window, and it was quite thin (though tall). The odd thing was, the curtains didn't cover the whole window. When I called reception to ask them how to close them, they brought us a pair of binder clips. Again, they couldn't have been nicer, but for a 4 or 5 star hotel to bring you binder clips? Very odd/disappointing. One other odd thing: the cable system was just like a box that you and I would have in our homes. This sounds nice, but 3/4 of the channels on the guide are blocked, so if you want to watch anything before bed or in the morning, it's a guessing game to know if what you see on the guide is available. A channel list would have been helpful. Overall, the place is very "fancy" but felt extremely cold to me. Almost like a hip prison. In the future, I would not book again at Jetsetter, and probably not at Gault (at least at that price). The people were exceptional, the room was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “If you like big rooms - this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: Madrid_viajero77
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of many Montreal hotels we plumped for this one... At first sight I wondered where all the people were, as it was supposed to be downtown Montreal in the heart of the old town. It is near (approx 10 mins walk) but not so near that you can hear the crowds passing your window. The room was massive, we reserved a Junior suite after some problems with the initial payment (this was our problem) and as you can see in the photos both the room and bathroom are considerably spacious. Both bathroom and bedroom furniture were extremely clean. Some days the floor could have been swept and cleaned - but that didn't detract from the overall splendour of the hotel, which was refurbished on the site of the first North American YMCA. The only thing missing from my point of view was a small sofa, as there was one easy chair in the room and to relax the only other option was to sit on the bed. The staff couldn't have been more attentive to our needs. We needed some adjustments to the air conditioning and we also booked a car through the hotel and Alejandro, Andre and Bettina more than helped us out. We were even given a specific route through lovely rural villages when we drove up to Quebec city which was prepared and written by Andre. So if you want to be pampered and looked after try the Gault in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “World-class service”
Reviews.Author: PeterFRI
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 16-17 with my wife and teenager (in adjoining room, whom we were dropping off in a summer French language program) Absolutely spotless (a must for our family of allergy sufferers). The decor is mid-century modern which I often lament is like sitting in a potato chip, but here it was surprisingly comfortable and warm in both the room and lobby. Loaner ipads for guest use was a nice amenity. Service was friendly and highly competent - too bad Trip Advisor's service rating only goes up to five. Gym is small but adequate. As we checked out we made reservations for a few weeks from now.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulnatale
Reviews.Content: My wife & I loved our stay at Hotel Gault. The room was spacious & comfortable, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the lobby/bar/restaurant area was a great place to relax after walking around the beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Tranby
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Gault. We loved the modern design and friendly staff who provided us with great restaurant recommendations. My only suggestion would be to expand the size of the gym, as it consists of only one treadmill, one elliptical machine and free weights. We would definitely stay here again, and look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: Gouri
Reviews.Content: The hotel has elegantly furnished rooms with designer furniture and impeccable service. The lobby is tastefully decorated, a great place to have breakfast or unwind after a day of walking around old Montreal. My 11-year old enjoyed borrowing the iPad (available at the reception) to browse. We had a wonderful stay and hope to be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, but not as amazing as before.”
Reviews.Author: linesandcurves
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here every summer for the last 4 years. This was by all means the hotel that we judged all other experiences. Beautiful design, warm, and just a feeling like you'd like to move in. Now through the years, though we still love The Gault, it has been the only hotel we stay while in MontrÃ©al, we have unfortunately felt its decline in experience. Last summer, we even asked the front desk if it was under new management or owners, and they confirmed it had in fact. This was a lovely place that offered many perks for the guest, and provided a feeling of absolute serenity. We enjoy the modular design in the rooms, and putting all of our belongings away and then laying on the Rodolpho Dordoni bed in the minimal room with the pre-set radio of Radio-Classique MontrÃ©al 99.5, however, it is very apparent that they're now trying to appeal to more of a club crowd. What felt intimate and like a hidden gem, is now feeling more trendy, and bringing in louder, club crowds. Now just to set this straight, I am from NYC, so noise doesn't bother me like it would bother people visiting from smaller Suburban towns, but going from what it was (to me at least) to what it feels like it is becoming, is quite a different experience. Needless to say, the staff are always very helpful, friendly, and up for a chat at the bar on an evening, and it seems genuine, not as if they are just paid to sit and smile. All in all, I will likely continue to stay here on my annual visit,(though I have actually looked into others now) but I thought it should be noted to the owners or management that it is not as amazing as it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “We are coming back to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wong_christine7
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research on where to stay in Montreal and we could have stayed at a less expensive hotel chain. But, instead we discovered this wonderful hotel in Old Montreal which was a perfect location. This was just a weekend trip, but it was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful about local attractions and restaurant recommendations. The hotel location was great and accessible walking distance to pretty much everywhere you wanted to go. Brian at front desk was very helpful too! We definitely will stay here again and plan to come visit very soon!. Yes, it can be pricey but you are getting what you pay for! Keep up to great work Hotel Gault!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Atmosphere and great stuff”
Reviews.Author: herve-miami
Reviews.Content: The location was one the main reason to stay at the Gault Hotel. However, form the moment that I checked in to the moment that I checked out, I was totally impressed by the great quality of the hotel and the professional and friendly staffs. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable, with great TV equipment and perfect wifi. Either you stay for business or for pleasure, the hotel location is perfect. I will definitely like to come back but this time for pleasure in order to enjoy that great atmosphere that the Gault Hotel is offering.

Reviews.Title: “Gault always wins at the Montreal Grand Prix”
Reviews.Author: Terry_S_11
Reviews.Content: We having been staying at this hotel during the Montreal Grand Prix for the past 8 years and we can only say that every stay is exceptional. The outstanding service of Andre the hotel's conceirge is unequalled to any other hotel we have experienced. We look forward to many more years of excellent service from this world class boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Andre rules”
Reviews.Author: Sporkyou
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice and clean, Andre was a great help booking dinners. Definitely rent the bikes up on McGill. Well worth the 5 bucks for the whole day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jens_spork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Gault for three nights and were very impressed. The staff go out of there way to assist and nothing seems to be too much trouble for them. The room was spacious and modern and the building itself is beautiful. An excellent location, near many wonderful restaurants in the historic area of Montreal. I highly recommend hotel Gault.

Reviews.Title: “Brian the concierge and the rest of the staff really made our group feel special.”
Reviews.Author: tom123456_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and in a great location in Montreal. We had a beautiful view of the city from our roof top balcony. Our small group from Boston really enjoyed our interaction with all the staff which was a highlight of staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MARINAROSEK
Reviews.Content: On the plus side: Wonderfully spacious rooms. Heated bathroom floors. Very comfy beds. Staff did everything and more to make my stay perfect, despite some things being out of their control. So on the negative side the air con can't be controlled in the rooms to the extent it can't be switched off and despite putting the dial down to 20 the temperature never got below 22.4C. I can imagine this might be a problem in the real heat of the summer. I gather this is a fault with the system they have and they can't do anything about it. To stop it blowing on me all night they had to tape up half the vent in the ceiling. I have never heard of air con that can't be switched off before. The air con problem extended to the gym (which is tiny and airless in the basement). The temperature in there was over 22 degrees and cannot be set any lower (I gather) than this which I have to say seems a bit bonkers when the room is hot before you have started a work out you melt after about 10 minutes. I ordered room service one night and got a panini which was extremely expensive and the size a child would eat. I would simply recommend you eat out rather than do room service. A very minor detail but there was no vanity set i.e. cotton wool etc in the bathrooms. Aside from the heating problems, the staff were wonderful and did what they could to help and couldn't have been nicer. I have highlighted the problems which I raised with the hotel and despite all these I would go back without doubt! Thanks to the staff for trying to do everything to help!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service - rooms I could live in for a year.”
Reviews.Author: chmlk
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful and caring from the very beginning, not only professional, but friendly and careing in a relaxed way. What I liked best was the rooms: clever layout, beautyful laid back palette, great fabrics and flexible lighting options. It was raining through most of my stay and having such a nice place helped a lot in not feeling cheated out of a vacation weekend. I also recommend (as the staff did) the Bocata restaurant, Olives et gourmandeaux and Le Cartet, all in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Walderek
Reviews.Content: We read tremendous things about this hotel on TA and it did not disappoint. We were greeted by exceptional service from the minute we pulled up. Andre went above the call of duty to recommend restaurants in the area, and was simply a very nice man to be around. I wish more hotels had people this genuinely friendly. The rooms were minimalist and modern as advertised. I stay in big brand hotels all week for work, and I can't imagine how you could prefer that option to this one. Finally, the location is outstanding. We walked throughout Old Montreal and stumbled into unique restaurants and shops close by and had no need for a car in this area. We noticed several other boutique hotels close by, all of which looked very nice. I'm sure Hotel Gault is among the finest. Look for their prepaid rates, we enjoyed a huge bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is beautiful but i got the worse room there.”
Reviews.Author: cchino623
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the service at the hotel was very good. The people are friendly and definitely helpful in every way. I recommend the breakfast there. You really can not go wrong with your choice of meals. The hotel has a cute library area in case you want to just sit and read for a bit before you head out to explore the city. It is in walking distance of the Basilica de Notre Dame and other must see sites during the day. At night there is a club to the north a block away so you are covered at all times. Now the one negative that put a damper on my stay. It seems on each floor they have a room that faces the parking lot in the back. And we just happened to get that room. We assume that it was because we used JetSetter and received a great rate for the weekend. This puts a negative on both JetSetter and Hotel Gault. And another reason to back up this theory is that when the hotel help took us to our room, they tried to show explain to us where everything in the room was, like the closet and hangers and restroom, but they werent familiar with the room and took time trying to figure things out and even said... wow i wonder why they made this room this way... So overall the hotel is great.. just make sure that you do not get the room in the corner which is located all the way to the right coming out of the elevator or you will spend your entire vacation with a view of the parking lot behind the building.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service with a Personal Touch”
Reviews.Author: 1_ShootingStar
Reviews.Content: My niece and I stayed at the Hotel Gault this weekend and we enjoyed every moment in this lovely hotel! While our rooms were beautiful, clean and very comfortable - the best feature of the Hotel was the outstanding staff and management who ensured that we had everything that we needed throughout our visit. Hotel Gault is within walking distance of many galleries, fine restaurants, shopping and the Waterfront in Old Montreal. I highly recommend Hotel Gault and I will definitely stay there again the next time I visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Old Montreal with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: PJG29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from an excellent weekend stay at Hotel Gault. The hotel itself was beautiful, very modern and clean. Our room was great (we had a Terra room) with a comfortable bed and huge bathroom with a large bathtub. Didn't spend much time in the room though, as we were fortunate to have great weather and we spent most of our weekend exploring the city. What really makes Hotel Gault stand out is the service. Everyone we encountered was friendly, enthusiastic, and happy to help. If you need anything at the Hotel Gault, Stephan is your man. He was able to get us a reservation at Au Pied de Cochon on relatively short notice, and the next day was able to get us a table at a great bar to watch the Canadiens-Bruins playoff game on even shorter notice. Also when we arrived at the hotel, he pointed out a parking spot available on the the street where we could leave our car for the weekend, which saved us from having to valet the car and pay for parking. That was huge. We did the Easter Brunch package and the buffet brunch was terrific as well. Great selection of pastries and a homemade jam that they should bottle and sell. They also had eggs, ham, baked beans, and crepes, the ham in particular was amazing. The staff (Dominic and another fellow, didn't get his name) was happy to make several cappucinos for my wife which she was raving about. Again, outstanding service from everyone. Didn't get any room service while we were there or try out the free popcorn and DVD rentals that Hotel Gault offers, however we did share an elevator with a very happy little girl who had a cartoon DVD and giant bowl of popcorn. Really can't think of any negatives about our visit, I don't think there were any. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone, I honestly can't ever remember staying somewhere with better service than Hotel Gault.

Reviews.Title: “What a spectacular little hotel - ME GUSTA MUCHO!”
Reviews.Author: dianulya
Reviews.Content: The Gault is a gem of a boutique hotel. We stayed in the Essential Double - the 350 sqft loft-style guestroom that seemed enormous to us! Such excellent decor and very nice touches such as a note of thanks and a plate with strawberries and chocolates. The staff were SO NICE and VERY HELPFUL. If you have a choice between a big hotel chain and this one - do not hesitate! It is very stylish and perfectly located. It makes you feel very glamorous and comfortable at the same time. Highly recommended. Este hotel es excelente!!! Es muy elegante y bien situado. Te hace sentir muy glamoroso y cÃ³modo al mismo tiempo. Altamente recomendado!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience, and we are already eager to return.”
Reviews.Author: WaywardComma
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Gault for five nights (Thursday to Tuesday), and were immediately impressed with the hotel's sleek yet down-to-earth style. Our room, an "Essential", was more akin to a funky city apartment than a dull hotel room. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and there was very little noise at night. We greatly enjoyed the spacious shower, heated floors, and roomy drawers for storing our clothing. Even then bathrobes that were tucked away in a closet smelled divine. **My only recommendation for the room would be the addition of a tea kettle or coffee pot, as I really enjoy a late-night tea/cocoa/decaf break. :) I would also suggest that the temperature in the basement gym be reduced, as my partner and I were a bit overheated whilst working out.** I must say that the most exceptional aspect of our stay at the hotel was the amazingly friendly and accommodating staff. Our first encounter upon arriving was with Andre, the bubbly and energetic concierge. He not only parked our car and helped us with our many bags (namely, rucksacks!), but also recommended a fabulous restaurant right off the bat, and made us a reservation immediately (at L'Orignal). He was also incredibly helpful in terms of our sightseeing destinations, including the Musee des Beaux Arts and the Chateau Dufresne (he highly recommended this after I expressed an interest, and it was well worth the visit!). Honestly, each and every staff member at the Hotel Gault was more than warm, generous, and thoughtful. I have never experienced such friendly, genuine hotel employees. My partner and I did a great deal of walking and exploring during our stay in Montreal, and this included walking approx. 3-8 miles per day. So, at the end of each adventure, we greatly needed decent food, cocktails, and a peaceful night's sleep. The Hotel Gault assisted us in all of our requirements, and we will happily pass on our five star review to friends, family, and TripAdvisor frequenters alike.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, comfortable, quiet, great location for business or sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: ShastaRho
Reviews.Content: Excellent location while attending a conference in Montreal; convenient for both conference center and sightseeing. The hotel staff in particular went out of their way on multiple occasions to help with everything from business needs to recommendations for local restaurants/sights to just plying me with coffees in the lobby while I worked on meeting a writing deadline. The decor was stylish, contemporary, peaceful, and nicely done mix with the historic stonework. Would be very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “an amazing hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Carmen097
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Hotel Gault on a number of occasions - both for leisure and business. It is, by far, the best hotel experience I have ever had for multiple reasons. First, the hotel is located in the Old Port of Montreal amongst interesting shops, restaurants and historical sites but is also only a 10 minute walk from a major shopping area of Montreal. Second, the rooms (and the hotel itself) are immaculate, modern chic with soaring windows, warm concrete floors, luxurious white bed linens (with a splash of colour), flat screen TVs and a funky, functional bathroom (my favorite is the room with the stand-alone bathtub!). The rooms are also the quietest I have ever experienced with no sounds from the other guestrooms. What has also always surprised me about the hotel is that while the rooms are spotless, I have never confronted the cleaning staff other than for the turn down service in the evening. They are unobtrusive and respectful. Finally, while all of this makes the hotel a great experience, the real jewel in the crown of the hotel is Brian, the Manager of Lodging and the amazing staff. They are, and have been on every occasion, the consumate professionals, kind, helpful and engaging. Because of Brain and the hotel staff our experiences at the Hotel Gault have left us relaxed, happy and looking forward to our next visit. I cannot reccommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel- superb staff-good food-quiet comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: LMB_VT
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel from a magazine article and was a bit concerned about a cold ambiance. We we're looking for a quiet 2 day getaway and we could not have been more pleasantly surprised. After driving through a blizzard, the staff at the Gault made us feel completely welcomed and relaxed. The room was dead quiet , the bed luxurious, the bathroom with tub had a great modern design. Our breakfast was prepared very well including great coffee. We felt as if we had a personal staff-Remi, Rausta and Benoit made our stay delightful, despite a foot of snow. There are some very interesting shops near the Nortre Dame Cathedral just a few blocks away. For an off season Montreal adventure- the Hotel Gault was a great discovery.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Gracious service in a stylish chic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sylvanavt
Reviews.Content: This serene little gem on the edge of Montreal's Old Town is perfect. Not only is it very stylish and cool, the staff is amazingly friendly. No "cool attitude" ... Just genuine kind staff that want your stay to be just how you want it to be. Though the decor is minimalist and hard edge in a way, it is one of the warmest, most pleasant hotels I've ever stayed in.... Sleek, chic, spare but very comfortable rooms, beautiful Porhault linens, perfect lighting.... As a former travel editor for a national magazine, and having traveled the world, this hotel is outstanding. And it's perfectly located. Easy to drive to, right near the metro and on the edge of Old Montreal but not in the busy thick of it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for R & R”
Reviews.Author: SNOWBLIZ
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Gault in Old Montreal and had the most perfect stay. From the moment we arrived every detail was taken care of. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable - especially about restaurants (for dinner) that were exceptional in the area. We wanted to get away and relax and that is exactly what we did. The hotel is located on a very quiet street so you do not hear any traffic noises which makes it peaceful. Our room was very spacious and we loved the in floor heat in the bathroom. We hope to return again this spring.

Reviews.Title: “We felt like rockstars all weekend”
Reviews.Author: RyanBurd
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gault is excellent. Great location in Old Montreal. Clean, minimalist decor. We were upgraded to a huge Etcetera room with California king, two-person soaking tub and heated bathroom floors. The staff is friendly, and service is excellent. Andrew the concierge can and will do anything. He got us a great table at an amazing sushi restaurant on very short notice. We enjoyed breakfast in bed before visiting the Montreal Museum of Fine Arts - part of a package deal we purchased. I can't say enough good things about Hotel Gault. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay for second time!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_613
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. This is our second stay here and we will definitely be back time and time again! A very small quaint place in the heart of Vieux (Old) Montreal. The staff here are courteous, friendly and extremely helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Exception Service”
Reviews.Author: Denver_Rome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gault over New Years, and were totally satisfied with the experience. The rooms were spacious, warm, and very cool. But what stood out was the service. Brian (front desk) and Andre (concierge) could not have been more polite, friendly, informed and accommodating, The restaurant recommendations were exceptional without fail. We had a (very) small problem with our room, and were immediately taken care of with a new,even nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, better than pictures”
Reviews.Author: nlgladstone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gault on a last minute trip for New Years. There were limited hotels available this close to new years, but the Gault was available and quite reasonably priced. We stayed in the standard room which is so much nicer and much, much larger than the pictures made it out to be. The service was wonderful, with great recommendations of places to eat and helped finding places that were open on new years day. Another plus was how much was included, bottled watter, wifi, etc., was all included. Fabulous cappuccinos as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy at Hotel Gault”
Reviews.Author: AKnappaDay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Gault Christmas Eve and Day with my mom, who was born on Christmas. It was a birthday trip and the staff at Hotel Gault acted as though there is nothing they'd rather do than accommodate us on Christmas Eve and Day. Brian, Philip and Relita, among others were kind and helpful. The food was delicious; the room comfortable and spacious; and the location was fantastic. We walked to Notre Dame Basilica. Good water pressure and internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful. friendly hotel but overpriced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: jacqand
Reviews.Content: I love boutique hotels and the clean loft-like look of the Gault was very appealing. The staff were fantastic. The bed very, very comfortable. The public rooms were very attractive. On the downside, the room chairs were uncomfortable, and the hotel is not set up properly for internet access. At these prices free wifi is a must, instead, I was given a short cable to connect to the internet and would have had to sit on the floor by the TV to use it. After trying it once with no success connecting, I gave up. The lack of wifi leaves no options for iphones, which is something the hotel should rethink. Fortunately there are a lot of hotspots in the city but I would not return to the Gault because no internet access was a significant inconvenience since I was booking rail tickets and making other arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Declan75
Reviews.Content: Love it! Beautiful building, cool lobby, really nice rooms, nice big bath to relax.... Excellent and professional service at the front desk.. only 30 rooms so have intimate feeling...

Reviews.Title: “Cute and cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: tom_vdv10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in Hotel Gault. Staff was friendly and very helpfull, helping us find points of interest and a restaurant. Really liked the room, a rather modern, cool but not cold interior. (Would have chosen another type of wood for the doors though, it didn't really fit with the style of the hotel interior) The room had an open plan, with a bathroom that was open and yet not too open to the bedroom. Comfortable bed, good shower. Location of the hotel is good as well, walking distance to the harbor and old town.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Love Hotel Gault”
Reviews.Author: inkcakes
Reviews.Content: Very, very well located on a quiet street within a couple blocks of Montreal's best restaurants (Borocco, Le Local, DNA, Olive+Gourmando, and Kitchen Gallerie Poisson). Our spacious room had a lovely terrace and sweeping views on both sides. Comfortable bed and pillows, big bathroom and sitting area. The staff could not have been more friendly and accommodating. Modern but not cold. My husband was on business and our teen daughter and I explored the city. Again well located for business travel (my husband could walk to some meetings) as well as exploring the old city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Still our favorite hotel, ever”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine13
Reviews.Content: We're modeling our master bedroom after this hotel room. Loved the open, contemporary styling within the older exterior. Plush and luxurious. Our favorite hotel, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Dog Friendly Loft-Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucythepug
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. Staff were so friendly and provided top notch recommendations for dinner and places to go. Very dog friendly. The only (bad) thing that happened was that our neighbour came hoe drunk-in heels and walk around her unit for about an hour.(?) The floors are concrete so we could hear here walking all around for that time. It was crystal clear to hear, so it woke us up. Other than that, the place was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: annathomas31
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gault was an absolutely stunning place to stay. The rooms were immaculately clean and simply stunning. The beds were just too comfortable as we did not want to get up the next morning. Instead of getting out of bed, we just called the front desk and stayed another day! lol. The entire Hotel was just exquisite and we hope to be able to spend some time there next summer. Great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ibohr
Reviews.Content: This is the best Hotel I've ever been: the furnishing was incredibly tasteful, the stuff was great and the location very good for discovering the city. The two types of rooms I know are very different but spacious and especially the beds were so comfy. But its worth to leave them for breakfast! Hotel Gault is located in the old city, so tis easy to reach many lnadmarks by foot. It is located closed to a metro station, too.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Artistic, and you can keep the slippers!”
Reviews.Author: karared3
Reviews.Content: Modern atmosphere with very nice staff. The room was pristine and had awesome exposed brick and a very large shower. Everything was perfect. If your going to be coming in late at night after drinking I suggest you buy some snack food for your room , there is no fast food/market/convenience store around.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of civilization”
Reviews.Author: Juris2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, both Montrealers, have stayed at the Gault no less than 9 times in the last three years, so the place is very familiar to us. The Gault is restrained luxury, from the zen (but top quality) decor to the subdued atmosphere (we have never encountered loud guests there). The beds are huge and extremely comfortable. Service is friendly and the staff does not change much - always a good sign. The location is quiet, with very easy access to Old Montreal and its restaurants. A mÃ©tro station is five minutes away. We have tried almost all types of rooms at the Gault, from the most basic ones to a large studio on the upper floor. Each room has got its own charm (personally, I have a soft spot for the Terra rooms and their brick wall). The bathrooms in each room are huge. However, if you prefer a bathtub, say so, because certain rooms only have showers. In some basic rooms, only a curtain separates the bathroom from the sleeping quarters: it's a nice touch, but some people will probably miss the privacy. Breakfast at the Gault used to be buffet-style, with both variety and quality. It also used to be included in the price of the room. Lately, however, it's been replaced by a rather traditional, Ã  la carte breakfast that costs around 20 dollars per person (in addition to the room itself). The change in breakfast policy was a disappointment during our last visit (July 2010). However, the Gault remains a very stylish, civilized and relaxing place to stay. We still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gault - lovely, but a bit strange in decor”
Reviews.Author: lolamini
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights recently at Hotel Gault for the jazz festival. It's in a great location in Montreal, near the Old City but away from the touristy section. The Hotel is in a renovated YMCA/Factory, and the rooms are enormous - but a bit strange! The floors are grey concrete, with just one rug, the furniture is a bit dorm-room like in terms of the desk/closet area. The bed was wonderful - comfortable with nice linens. Windows were enormous and huge with drapes that really kept it dark and quiet. My least favorite part of the room was the bathroom. It wasn't really a separate room - they put giant pocket doors across part of the room to create the bathroom. It, too, was huge - but could have been made warmer in decor. The concrete floors, a tiny separate toilet room (also with a pocket door), a soaking tub in the middle of the room, and hard to find amenities (tissues, for example), made for a strange experience. And just opening and closing the pocket doors was cumbersome and noisy. The staff was terrific - recommended great restaurants, and breakfast was delicious, although there are cheaper places a few blocks away. All in all, we liked it and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Industrial chic”
Reviews.Author: southendgirlfriend
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Gault. The industrial chic vibe, very stylish and cool concrete floors, contemporary bed, drapes, very cool bathroom. The only minor tiny comment would be the lack of shelf space and storage for all of our stuff. However, we loved the hotel staff, who were incredibly obliging and helpful with reservations and ideas of what to do in the city. The breakfasts had an unbelievable variety of items and was fresh and beautifully presented. The bar was cool, and the espresso delicious. The location was great. Valet parking terrific. Can't say enough good things about this place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service at the Hotel Gault”
Reviews.Author: missmc123
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the staff at the Hotel Gault for all of the wonderful recommendations about what to do and see in the city. Upon my initial arrival, later in the evening, I was greeted by name and warmly welcomed. The room was very cool and modern and the location of the hotel cant be beat for access to everything. Everyone was so friendly and helpful at all times and the price of the room was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as nice as I remembered it, but still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: synaptoneurosome
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gault has beautiful rooms, a very nice breakfast spread, and is situated in an ideal location - what's not to love? Very little, I would say, but I do think you pay for it. If you can find a good bargain on the room rate, I would recommend staying there (especially because Montreal has more than its fare share of bland, tasteless generic hotel rooms) - but paying full price would seem like a rip off - it's certainly very nice, but certainly not worth the full-fare price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Clique, classy & romantic - place to stay for a special night!”
Reviews.Author: JeroenAlexander
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at Hotel Gault - big friendly and sincere welcome from doorman Andre, upgrade to the wonderful loft with massagebed and huge design tub. Service is awesome. We bought Some champagne in the neighbourhood and we a big smile they brought glasses and an icebucket from the bar to the room. Fully agree with the "best luxury" award! Not cheap but well-spend!

Reviews.Title: “Great R&R, hip, comfortable, friendly. Cant wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: montage
Reviews.Content: I'm from New England and have been to Mongolia - however, never to Montreal. I was curious to see if it was "enough" of a city for me. It turned out to be a pleasant city. We decided to take an easy R&R weekend and booked at The Hotel Gault. The experience was a COMPLETE pleasure. Visually stunning, yet incredibly comfortable. I booked a mid level room and it was a great value for the huge space we stayed in. The contemporary, minimalism was tastefully balanced by inviting beds with great linens, a independent, HUGE tub, upscale soaps...etc... The hotel staff were right on target - very helpful, yet not in your way. Im a lobby person, and the atmosphere was calming and visually sophisticated. Im also a reader, and loved the "den" with its library of design, art, travel, fashion books - and skimmed through them in front of the soothing fireplace. The first night we stayed in to watch a movie (you actually pic a movie from their movie library) and they sent popcorn to our room. Maybe that seems like a minimal point - but it was JUST what we needed. This place is a new oasis for us and we plan on being regulars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect inner city haven - repeat custom is guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: Catleader
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a tiny side-street strongly reminiscent of Old Geneva or historic Paris, the Hotel Gault is one of the best hotels I have stayed at. What it lacks in subtle luxurious touches, it more than makes up for in being everything a hotel should be - extremely clean, firm and comfortable bed, spacious room, superb staff, excellent location and decent food. I am staying at the Hotel Gault for 4 days on my own on a personal visit. The most excellent Andre, Jonathan and their colleagues made me feel welcome from the moment I walked in past midnight straight from a 20 hr trip around the world. Walking into the large king bed room on the strains of clear classical music from the radio/CD player was the perfect recipe for relaxation. The rooms are almost spartan and certainly reminds one of hotels in Basel or Zurich, but with 100 times more space. There are only 30 rooms in the hotel, on 5 floors, so it is quiet, on a quiet street.
